snippet: Antigovernment activists reported attacks against insurgent enclaves in a Mediterranean port and at least two major cities.
abstract: Anti-government activists claim that Syrian forces attacked insurgent enclaves in Mediterranean port and at least two major cities, possibly leaving dozens of people dead; journalists find it difficult corroborate those reports, given the country's restricted access.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Alan Cowell from Paris, Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul, Thom Shanker and Mark Landler from Washington, and Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Antigovernment activists reported attacks against insurgent enclaves in a Mediterranean port and at least two major cities.

headline.seo: Syrian Forces Strike Rebels in Wide-Ranging Assaults
headline.main: Syrian Forces Strike Rebels in Wide-Ranging Assaults
headline.print_headline: Syrian Forces Strike Rebels in Wide-Ranging Assaults

keywords.value: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces
keywords.name: organizations
